definition: to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Continue to breathe throughout the exercise and don’t hold your breath.
sentences.chinese: 訓練過程中持續保持呼吸不要屏氣。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the image characteristics and quality of MR plain scan with breath-holding in normal lungs.
sentences.chinese: 目的評價正常肺磁共振屏氣平掃的圖像特徵和質量。

sentences.english: They are an amphibious species with hardy lungs capable of holding breath for extended periods.
sentences.chinese: 他們是水陸兩棲生物，肺部發達，能夠長時間屏氣。

sentences.english: He listened to the music with rapt attention.
sentences.chinese: 他屏氣凝神地聽著音樂。

sentences.english: Don't hold your breath in any posture or without your teacher's instructions.
sentences.chinese: 在沒有老師指導的情況下，任何一個動作都不要屏氣。

sentences.english: White deer and 5 disciples sat by him, holding their breath and listened carefully.
sentences.chinese: 白鹿與五弟子分坐周圍，屏氣凝聽。

sentences.english: He purchased a new stop watch and was practicing breath-hold diving in a medical-therapy pool.
sentences.chinese: 他購買了新的秒錶，並實行屏氣的醫療治療跳水池。

definition: lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new
sahasrāra or sahasrara, the crown or fontanel chakra 查克拉, residing at the top of the skull
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
manipūra or manipura, the solar plexus chakra 查克拉, residing in the upper abdomen
